Package dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.itemspawn

Class BaseItemSpawn

java.lang.Object
dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.BaseEvent
dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.itemspawn.BaseItemSpawn
Direct Known Subclasses:
DropParty, Feast, OreDropParty
public abstract class BaseItemSpawn extends BaseEvent
Abstract base class for item spawning events that handles item distribution around players. This class provides configurable spawning behavior for items in the Minecraft world, including options for:
  • Single or continuous spawning
  • Group or spread distribution
  • Random or fixed item types
  • Surface-only or 3D space spawning
  • Liquid (water/lava) spawning permissions
Each spawned item is marked with a unique identifier for tracking and later cleanup. The class supports weighted random selection of items and various safety checks to ensure valid spawn locations.
See Also:
  • BaseEvent
  • EventClassification

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Executes the item spawn event. Either starts continuous spawning or performs a one-time spawn for all players.
      Specified by:
      execute in class BaseEvent

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      Terminates the event by stopping any continuous spawning tasks.
      Specified by:
      terminate in class BaseEvent

    • startContinuousTask

      public boolean startContinuousTask()
      Starts a continuous spawning task if one is not already running.
      Returns:
      true if task was started, false if already running

    • stopContinuousTask

      public boolean stopContinuousTask()
      Stops the current continuous spawning task if one is running.
      Returns:
      true if task was stopped, false if no task was running
